channel.title: ASF JIRA

item.title: [JENA-1039] Race condition on OWL.java class constructor
item.description:
latest master (fa26eefe0f55ae26cde88e7a4945bc9349a7e5f5) fails mvn clean install on jena-arq:

[INFO] Compiling 284 source files to /home/stain/src/jena/jena-arq/target/test-classes

uses unchecked or unsafe operations.

Every test in jena-arq fails with a similar java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:

I assume this is caused by the initial ExceptionInInitializerError from (ProfileRegistry - relating to the recent JenaSystem.init() change

(jena-arq builds fine on 3.0.0 tag)

item.summary: Race condition on OWL.java class constructor

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Some kind of race condition.. ProfileRegistry does

/** The URI that maps to the language profile for OWL-Full */
    public static final String OWL_LANG = OWL.FULL_LANG.getURI();

but FULL_LANG on line 49 in OWL.java is:

public static final Resource FULL_LANG = m_model.getResource( getURI() );

but we are already part of OWL's class constructor on line 36, 

    private static final Model m_model = ModelFactory.createDefaultModel();

Avoiding this inter-twingled static initialization code is why people invented Spring.. This is screaming for further refactoring..

So it's partially caused by InitJenaCore just calling OWL.getURI() (which the compiler figures out is just a String constant) rather than say OWL.FULL_LANG.getURI() - thus the individual constants of OWL from OWL.m_model has not necessarily been created yet during class initialization.

The biggest problem in that OWL requires ModelFactory, that also forces JenaSystem.init(). Thus both OWL and ModelFactory must participate in initialization.

This simple test highlights the problem - if run standalone:

package org.apache.jena.vocabulary.test;

import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;

import org.apache.jena.vocabulary.OWL;
import org.junit.Test;

// Deliberately not part of the test case 
public class TestOWLConstruction {
	
	@Test
	public void testName() throws Exception {
		assertEquals("http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#sameAs", OWL.sameAs.getURI());
	}
}

Changing InitJenaCore to call OWL.init() does not help:

	public static void init() {
    	System.out.println(m_model != null);
    }

which prints out "false". Obviously one can make m_model non-final and set it from final if null - but that does not mean that the rest of OWL.java has been initialized for code which first Jena thing they do is the equivalent of OWL.FULL_LANG.getURI(). And obviously we don't want the public constants to be non-final!

The ProfileRegistry can be changed to look up String constants instead, which might help as a workaround. But I'm not very convinced by cross-module class initialization dependencies like what has been introduced now.

GitHub user stain opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/jena/pull/93

JENA-1039: Avoid race-condition to OWL constants

Fixes JENA-1039(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/JENA-1038) race condition.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/stain/jena JENA-1039

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/jena/pull/93.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #93

commit b1da86b0c3def6b9253639ad0d89563f2468d9bf
Author: Stian Soiland-Reyes <stain@apache.org>
Date: 2015-10-01T02:11:29Z

JENA-1039: Avoid race-condition to OWL constants
This pull request avoids the particular race condition, but I would not rule out that there could be other ways to trigger the same problem when calling JenaSystem.init() from a static {} block.
Sorry, I'll leave the issue Open until the pull request has been accepted.

The fix on PR#93 will work for this specific case. I think a general answer is a fix in ARQ's NodeValue and NodeConst to require initialization of their dependencies at the start of their class initialization. It is an unusual path to call NodeValue and NodeConst so early (the tests are poking around with internal variables) but should be made to work.

I checked the ARQ code base for other occurrences for this pattern and found one other in ARQConstants where OWL is used but ARQ has not ensured Jena core initialization had been done.

In OWL, the first call in class initialization is a call to ModelFactory.createDefaultModel which causes Jena initialization and this can call back into OWL which has not initialized completely at that point. OWL is different to other core vocabularies like RDF in that it does not use ResourceFactory. Changing might be worthwhile but it would not necessarily fix the problem all together - just move it elsewhere because the pattern used in OWL occurs elsewhere (not in core vocabularies).

Proposed solution:

  1. (ARQ level) Add JenaSystem.init to NodeValue, NodeConst and ARQConstants
  2. Rework OWL to use ResourceFactory.

This makes ProfileRegistry safe.

Commit 873993cfb74b0a6728d8bb29532a0583e0912fb9 in jena's branch refs/heads/master from andy.seaborne
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=jena.git;h=873993c ]

JENA-1039: Ensure dependent OWL constants initialized before proceeding

Commit 1f9de03793e8791b5a57e78cf94c595fc015b14c in jena's branch refs/heads/master from andy.seaborne
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=jena.git;h=1f9de03 ]

JENA-1039: Tidy up file - add notes about initialization.

Commit 859ca7257078a23f4215719749caf2204e48683d in jena's branch refs/heads/master from andy.seaborne
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=jena.git;h=859ca72 ]

JENA-1039: Use ResourceFactory, not a locally created Model.

Please test. The build was fine for me so it looks like your environment is causing a different order so it's good to catch this.

I have not at the moment applied PR#93 - instead I did a deeper change to OWL which should make the existing code in ProfileRegistry safe. I managed to find some similar problems that PR#93 wasn't about (i.e. same root cause, not related to ProfileRegistry but other derived constants in other classes).

If the code is clean, we can keep ProfileRegistry as-is as a known place to highlight issues. If it is still problematic in any environments, I suggest we apply PR#93.

Github user afs commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/jena/pull/93#issuecomment-145077510

See the discussion on JENA-1039. A more comprehensive set of changes applied which should mean that this specific fix is not needed. Testing will tell.

Commit 620c5660a91ac6246141124efdf319391498d495 in jena's branch refs/heads/master from andy.seaborne
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=jena.git;h=620c566 ]

JENA-1039: Comprehensive changes including rewrite of OWL.

This closes #93

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/jena/pull/93
